position: General Maintenance Admin Assistant Volunteer (01 post), based in Phnom Penh.
Job Description:
Responsibilities

- Assist in follow up all installation and reparation work from technicians: electricity, air-con, plumbing and other maintenance work
- Collaborate with PSE key people in Smile Construction Services (SCS) and Smile Vehicle Services (SVS) to follow up their daily check, and maintenance schedule
- Help evaluate working performance of SCS and SVS

- Keep and manage all documents in a good manner

Requirements

- Strong willingness to learn and share both knowledge and experience

- Good interpersonal communication and team player

Company Profile:
Pour un Sourire d’ Enfant (PSE) is a non-profit organization, established at the end of 1995 in Cambodia, working to provide food, shelter, medical care, general education and vocational training to children needing support, e.g. underprivileged children; maltreated children; children living in poverty and children without any formal education in Phnom Penh, Sihanoukville and Siem Reap. 

Currently PSE is providing help to more than 6,500 children, supporting around 3,000 children in public schools, 1,500 in the remedial education program, and 1,500 in the vocational training program. Around 500 children benefit from specific educational programs: classes for children with disability, day-care centers, infant welfare etc.

PSE employs more than 500 dedicated staff. Due to rapid growth of existing and new programs, PSE is seeking candidates for the position of Gardener (01 post), based in Phnom Penh.

position.

Job Description:
To ensure that the procurement of products or services required for the satisfactory operation of the company is handled in a transparent, timely, efficient and effective manner in obtaining the quality products or services at lowest total cost of ownership through competitive procurement from qualified vendors.
•	Conduct bidding/purchasing upon receiving Purchase Request (PR) from technical and IT department and sending out the Request for Quotation/Proposal (RFQ/RFP) to potential vendors. 
•	Prepare the comparison table, conduct negotiation with supplier for price and other terms & conditions to select the winner and get further approvals.
•	Operate in the system for Purchase Order if required and provide the supporting documents in accordance with company policies and procedures.
•	Provide administrative support to Head of Procurement for technical data collection, updates and reporting for Procurement Operation within the Group.
•	Prepare reports and insures accuracy of data collected and reported from multiple data sources on request from Head of Procurement.
•	Lead for the internal check of cross function in the procurement department and make the summary report.
•	Manages and controls all activities relating to purchase orders, contracts, commercial and procurement aspect for Technical Department.
•	Update and follow up the status of PR pending list requested by technical departments and interface with involved requestors.
•	Assist Head of Procurement to find the quotation and outsourcing for the overseas suppliers to meet the company business operation/purpose. 
•	Maintain and keep filing updated suppliers database for technical and IT.
•	Coordinate for internal weekly meeting for procurement department like consolidate the agenda, take minute of meeting, remind the action items and follow up the status with the responsible person with timeline.
•	Be responsible for preparation of tender document based on the requirement from the requestors. 
•	Solve the problem regarding to payment process, requirements or issues from other departments and perform administrative works.
•	Perform any tasks as assigned by superior.
Job Requirement:
A. Academic Qualification: 
•	Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, or related field.
•	Additional education in Supply Chain and Procurement and experience in Telco area would be an advantage.

B. Skills required:

•	Must demonstrate personal attributes such as loyalty and integrity.
•	Be able to work independently with minimum supervision with can do aptitude.
•	Be proactive, initiative, faster learner, result and accuracy focus.
•	Negotiation skills and Analytical skills, and Report writing.
•	Good interpersonal, team building and team working.
•	Good communication and management skills.
•	Ability to work with others/function as a part of a team and maintain good working relationship with other departments, customer oriented.

Working Experience: 
•	A minimum of 2 years of procurement work.
Company Profile:
Smart Axiata Co., Ltd., Cambodia’s leading mobile telecommunications operator, currently serves 8 million subscribers under the ‘Smart’ brand. Smart Axiata is part of Axiata Group Berhad, one of Asia’s largest telecommunications groups.

Smart is at the forefront of mobile technology advancement in Cambodia. Smart was the first network to introduce 4G LTE in 2014, 4G+ in 2016 and 4G+ with HD Voice (VoLTE) in early 2017. In mid-2017, Smart introduced cutting-edge 4.5G, manifesting its data leadership position in Cambodia. Smart also provides 2G, 2.5G, 3G and 3.75G mobile services as well as international roaming across more than 190 countries. Its extensive nationwide network coverage stretches to more than 98% of the Cambodian population.

The company is also rapidly transforming itself into a digital lifestyle brand, having introduced many innovative offerings and lifestyle entertainment value propositions. This includes various international partnerships, with brands as diverse as Universal Music, Apple, Facebook and iflix, as well as digital services including SmartLuy, Smart Insurance, SmartPay, Smart Music and SmartNas. Smart aspires to become Cambodia’s Digital Champion, while playing an active role in socio-economic growth.

The company’s workforce consists of more than 1000 local and foreign experts. Smart is committed to its customers, employees and the people of Cambodia, in delivering its promise of enriching their lives through world-class networks, exceptional digital experiences and through significant corporate social responsibility engagements.
Contact Info: Contact Information Kanhaly  010202136 No464 A, Monivong Blvd, Sangkat Tonlebasac, Khan Chamkarmoan, Phnom Penh   010202136

job title: Director of Communication and Fundraising (01 post), based in Phnom Penh.
position: Director of Communication and Fundraising (01 post), based in Phnom Penh.
Job Description:
	Lead and formulate strategic plan and design for the department of communication and fundraising
	Coordinate and oversee  all aspects of public relation and communication work  for the whole department to achieve the department objectives and increase public relation awareness
	Lead the team to maintain and build a good connection and network with all partners to ensure the benefits of employment and fund raising
          Responsibilities

- Create and liaise with key people to build a positive relationship with them if necessary 
- Develop and enforce communication strategies, channel, policies and other publications to promote the information flow from across departments and external stakeholders widely and effectively
-Develop, control and edit all medias and publications of PSE such as press release, newsletters, reports, brochures, leaflets, backdrops and others complied with PSE policies
- Supervise the fundraising activities 
- Develop the project proposal to donors and stakeholders    
- Planning, managing and control the budgeting and expenses of department
- Managing the Cambodian and Expatriate Team
Job Requirement:
Requirements	

- Minimum bachelor's degree in marketing, communication, public relations or other relatedfields        
- Minimum five year experiences with senior management position in NGOs or Private Sectors related to either sale, marketing, fundraising, communication, public relation or similar with a proven track record of achievement  
- Experiences in proposal writing in private and institution context
- Excellent both written and verbal communication skills plus presentation skills
- Strong organizational skills and ability to handle multiple tasks and meet deadlines
- Ability to integrate organization goal to communication and public relation goal
- Advance MS Office (Ms. Word, Ms. Excel, Ms. PowerPoint, Outlook…)
- Good command of English and French 
- Be self-directed, autonomous, and initiative
- Be able to travel to province frequently
              Benefits
Competitive salary, retirement benefits, family health supporting, insurance, and training will be provided to successful candidates.

Company Profile:
Mtrading is an international financial company with offices in 45 countries worldwide. Since the year 2001, Mtrading have provided clients with the most innovative trading technology on the global financial markets using the modern multifunctional trading platform Meta Trader 4. Being a part of a very dynamic industry.

We are always on the lookout to add new prospective members to our team. You can find more information about Mtrading here: kh.mtrading.com

We are currently expanding the coverage of our business to Cambodia and looking for suitable candidates to develop our sales in Cambodian market. 

We need people to handle the sales process of warm leads calling and closing sales. You will be calling to demo account traders, traders room users, forexball participants, real account applicants and other lists of potential clients worldwide to sell the idea of opening a real account, depositing and trading with Mtrading.

The superior service of Mtrading provide advanced solutions concerning currency internet-trading 

(FOREX Spot) and Contracts for Difference (CFD) for US stocks, indices and futures (crude oil & gas).

Our goal is to develop a mutually beneficial relationship in order to serve your clients at the highest professional 

level while offering competitive compensation packages and other rewards to you.
Contact Info: Contact Information AM Cambodia  023 4567 789 Room 692, Building F (near Khemerak University), Phnom Penh Center, Cambodia.  023 4567 789

job title: Community Trainer (01 post), based in Phnom Penh.
position: Community Trainer (01 post), based in Phnom Penh.
Job Description:
	Design and plan soft skill training programs for community project 

            Responsibilities

- Organize, and facilitate training workshops to community people 
- Provide home visit frequently to follow up training effectiveness and family situation 
- Build a good relation with similar external institutions to find  guest speakers to  present in each workshop
- Develop various training materials and visual aid for the training
- Work closely and seek collaboration from local authority and community people to organize the workshop
- Provide and control training logistics and equipment
- Welcome donors and other partners and assist food,  logistics, transportation and others 
- Help translate from English to Khmer and vice versa during site visits for foreign visitors
- Write a report for manager

Requirements

- Minimum one year working experience related
-Strong ability in facilitation and communication skills          
- Some knowledge of research process, field survey, or M and E
- IT literate (Ms. Word, Ms. Excel, Ms. PowerPoint, E-mail…)
- Good command of English; French is a plus
- Be flexible, dynamic and patient
-Respect and support the value and mission of PSE
         Benefits

Competitive salary, retirement benefits, family health supporting, insurance, and training will be provided to successful candidates.

Pour un Sourire d’ Enfant (PSE) is a non-profit organization, established at the end of 1995 in Cambodia, working to provide food, shelter, medical care, general education and vocational training to children needing support, e.g. underprivileged children; maltreated children; children living in poverty and children without any formal education in Phnom Penh, Sihanoukville and Siem Reap. 

Currently PSE is providing help to more than 6,500 children, supporting around 3,000 children in public schools, 1,500 in the remedial education program, and 1,500 in the vocational training program. Around 500 children benefit from specific educational programs: classes for children with disability, day-care centers, infant welfare etc.

PSE employs more than 500 dedicated staff. Due to rapid growth of existing and new programs, PSE is seeking candidates for the position of Gardener (01 post), based in Phnom Penh.
